head.title: Maureen Towers And J. P. Natkin

hedline.hl1: Maureen Towers And J. P. Natkin

block.p: Maureen Towers, a daughter of Mary Towers of Morristown, N.J., and the late Edward J. Towers, was married yesterday to J. P. Natkin, the son of Judith and Robert Natkin of West Redding, Conn. The Rev. Clifton Palmer, a minister of the Church of Religious Science, performed the ceremony at the summit of Big Mountain in Whitefish, Mont.
The couple both received master's degrees in international relations from Johns Hopkins University. Mrs. Natkin, 30, graduated from Dartmouth College, and Mr. Natkin, 35, from Boston University.

Maureen Towers, a daughter of Mary Towers of Morristown, N.J., and the late Edward J. Towers, was married yesterday to J. P. Natkin, the son of Judith and Robert Natkin of West Redding, Conn. The Rev. Clifton Palmer, a minister of the Church of Religious Science, performed the ceremony at the summit of Big Mountain in Whitefish, Mont.
The couple both received master's degrees in international relations from Johns Hopkins University. Mrs. Natkin, 30, graduated from Dartmouth College, and Mr. Natkin, 35, from Boston University.

The bride was until recently a privatization and investment consultant for the International Finance Corporation in Moscow, where the bridegroom worked as the country manager for Vanguard Petroleum of Australia. He is the founder and managing director of Blankenship Inc., an energy and natural-resources development consulting concern in Houston.

The bride's father was a partner in the Freight Handling and Equipment Company in Lakewood, N.J. Her mother is the executive assistant to the president of Annin & Company, a flag manufacturer, in Roseland, N.J.

The bridegroom's parents are painters in West Redding. His father's work is included in collections at the Whitney Museum of American Art, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Guggenheim Museum and the Museum of Modern Art. WEDDINGS
